headline: Perplexity CEO Says On-Device AI Threatens Data Centers As Industry Faces '$10 Trillion Question' — Apple, Qualcomm Positioned To Benefit
summary: Aravind Srinivas, CEO of Perplexity AI, which is backed by Jeff Bezos and Nvidia Corp. (NASDAQ:NVDA), issued a contrarian warning about the future of artificial intelligence, saying on-device intelligence running on personal devices could disrupt the centralized data center model driving massive infrastructure investments. Localized AI Could Upend Data Center Industry “The biggest threat to a data center is if the intelligence can be packed locally on a chip that’s running on the device and then

headline: Why Nvidia Could Have a Terrible Year in 2026, And Why It Might Not Be So Bad
summary: Among the top-performing (and most closely-watched) stocks in the market, Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) has to be on every investor’s radar. That’s mostly because this is the largest company in the world. As such, Nvidia’s price movements on a daily basis can swing the market in one direction or another – that’s how market cap-weighted indices work, after all. ... Why Nvidia Could Have a Terrible Year in 2026, And Why It Might Not Be So Bad

headline: Is the AI Boom a Bubble Waiting to Pop? Here’s What History Says
summary: The S&P 500 Index jumped 16% in 2025, with AI winners Nvidia Corp., Alphabet Inc., Broadcom Inc. and Microsoft Corp. contributing the most.  But at the same time, concerns are mounting about the hundreds of billions of dollars Big Tech has pledged to spend on AI infrastructure.

content.summary: The S&P 500 Index jumped 16% in 2025, with AI winners Nvidia Corp., Alphabet Inc., Broadcom Inc. and Microsoft Corp. contributing the most.  But at the same time, concerns are mounting about the hundreds of billions of dollars Big Tech has pledged to spend on AI infrastructure.

headline: Is DFAC ETF Still A Buy After 15% Run?
summary: The Dimensional U.S. Core Equity 2 ETF (NYSEARCA:DFAC) has delivered a 15% gain over the past year, essentially matching the S&P 500’s return. Investors paid for Dimensional’s factor-based approach and got market performance. DFAC’s 2026 performance will likely depend less on 2025 results and more on what drives 2026 returns. DFAC manages nearly $40 billion ... Is DFAC ETF Still A Buy After 15% Run?

headline: Top analyst resets price target on Micron stock
